stimulusHtml: Respond to all parts of the question.

features.html:
Assume the United States economy is in recession.

  1. Draw a correctly labeled graph of the long-run aggregate supply, short-run aggregate supply, and aggregate demand curves, and show each of the following.

    1. Current price level, labeled PL1

    2. Current output, labeled Y1

  2. Now assume the euro zone, a major trading partner of the United States, enters into a recession.

    1. What will be the effect on United States exports to the euro zone? Explain.

    2.  On your graph in part (a), show the effect of the change identified in part (b) (i) on real output in the United States.

    3. What will be the effect of the change identified in part (b)(ii) on unemployment in the United States?

  3. Assume the euro zone recession causes a decrease in the demand for United States dollars in the foreign exchange market.

    1. Will the euro appreciate, depreciate, or remain unchanged against the dollar? Explain.

    2. Draw a correctly labeled graph of the foreign exchange market for dollars, and show the effect of the decrease in the demand for dollars on the exchange rate for dollars.

  4. Assume the United States implements a combination of expansionary fiscal and monetary policies. In the absence of complete crowding out, what will be the effect of these policies on each of the following?

    1. Aggregate demand in the United States

    2. The price level in the United States

    3. Interest rates in the United States. Explain.
